page.title: 11Colhayne Farm
page.content: This farm is sited about \ mile from the A35 down a track which eventually leads to Umborne. Running the farm are Mr & Mrs Hurford (jun), Mr Hurford (Sen) and a single farm hand. It is mainly dairy (Fresians) 50 cows and 20 young stock imported for fattening. Turkeys are reared as a Christmas extra and a few sheep are grazed for half the year. There are two farm houses (the original and a new house for the older Hurfords), a milking parlour, silage pits, hay sheds and winter accomodation for the cattle. The fields are both on the slopes of the Umborne valley and in the valley bottom. The railway line cuts through the farmland.(approximately 80 acres).Recently two holiday accomodations have been converted from farm barns.
